main event: A bright, very light object was observed over San Francisco by a civilian woman on August 2, 1952.
interesting points: The observed object was described as round, emitting a dull, orange-red glow and with a diameter estimated to be 25-30 feet.
It moved erratically at a rapid speed, changing direction several times, ruling out the possibility of it being a light on a building.
A Naval Station conducting training in the area reportedly refused to take information about the sighting.
The report was concurred by the preparing officer but insufficient information was available to determine the identity of the sighted object.
The duration of the sighting was 1 minute, and it was observed from the ground at an elevation of 35 degrees to the northwest.
sighted object: bright, very light object with a dull, orange-red glow
witnesses: civilian woman, Mr. Lewis V. Westhook (Asst. Dir. of Intel. 9th Air Div, Hamilton AFB, Calif.)
